page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Farming has been important in this area for centuries:indeed until the 1960's it was the dominant activity.Farms vary considerably in size - from the small farm of 50acres or so to the very large over 800 acres.Nevertheless all are mixed farms - livestock and crops (fodder and cash) with an emphasis on beef cattle. There are no specialist farms. Two farms were selected for more detailed study:Broomhill and Kincraig. Broomhill Farm (GR 719716) is a small mixed farn of 53 acres and is worked by the owner and his family:there are no employees though casual labour is taken on at harvest time.
